column8: Level of Political Stability - Conflict Affected
column18: Participant's Access to Technology eg. phones, internet - High
column19: Participant's Access to Technology eg. phones, internet - Medium
column20: Participant's Access to Technology eg. phones, internet - Low

column28: Potential for Inclusion of Marginalised Girls - Medium

column31: Potential for Behavioural Insight Integration - Medium

column38: Description
Structured questionnaires administered via phones/web to generate comparable numeric estimates of outcomes and determinants.
Repeat interviews with the same participants over time to understand trajectories, turning points, and drivers of change.
Repeated survey waves (panel/cohort) to measure change over time and relate it to exposure, events, or implementation shifts.
Participants use photography plus facilitated discussion/captioning to document experiences and communicate priorities to decision-makers.
Participants create short films or digital stories to express priorities and document change, supported by facilitation and ethical safeguards.
Participants submit time-ordered entries (text/audio/photo) via phones/apps to capture experiences as they happen and reduce recall bias.
Small-group story-sharing with agreed prompts and facilitation to surface lived experience, sense-making, and collective reflection.
Mapping and analysing relationships (who connects to whom, influence, information flow) to understand diffusion, support, and gatekeeping.
Paper-based or offline diary entries captured at agreed intervals, useful where connectivity is limited or privacy risks are high.
Participatory story-based monitoring where stakeholders collect, select, and discuss the most significant change stories to interpret what matters and why.
Participants create life-size or schematic body outlines to discuss embodied experiences, safety, wellbeing, and identity in a structured, trauma-aware way.
One-off semi-structured or in-depth interviews to elicit detailed personal accounts, meanings, and decision processes.
Standardised, tested multi-item instruments (e.g., Likert-type attitude/self-efficacy scales) used to measure latent constructs with attention to validity and reliability.
One-time (single round) survey snapshot used to estimate prevalence and explore associations at a point in time.
Structured mapping of a user's pathway through services (steps, touchpoints, drop-offs) to diagnose friction and equity gaps.
Facilitated group conversations to explore norms, experiences, language, and reasons behind behaviours and choices.
Routine programme/service records (registrations, case management, payments, attendance) repurposed for monitoring and analysis.
Rapid SMS/WhatsApp/social polling that gathers near real-time feedback from enrolled users, often for programme adaptation and accountability.
Participatory mapping of local services/assets, access barriers, and quality/coverage gaps to support planning and accountability.
Ongoing tracking of whether planned policy actions are adopted, financed, and executed, using structured indicators and evidence logs.
Systematic collection and analysis of digital content (social media, forums, search patterns) to track narratives, sentiment, and misinformation risks.
